text: The 103rd Regiment of Foot was a British Army regiment raised in Bristol in May 1794. The regiment was raised by Lieutenant-Colonel William Dyott. Initially known as the Loyal Bristol Regiment, it was renumbered as the 103rd Regiment of Foot later that year but disbanded the following year when personnel were transferred to the 4th Regiment of Foot and the 7th Regiment of Foot. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Infantry regiments of the British Army Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1795 Category:Military units and formations established in 1795
title: 103rd Regiment of Foot (1794)
